Show all your work for each part of the the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

A cylinder with cross-sectional area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> and height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> has a lid with mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> on top, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. There are <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>N</mi></math> atoms of an ideal gas inside the cylinder. The lid rests on top of the cylinder and is not attached to the cylinder. The pressure outside the cylinder is <math alttext="P sub atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>atm</mi></msub></math>.

(a) The gas in the cylinder is slowly heated and it increases in temperature. When it reaches a certain temperature, the lid accelerates upward and loses contact with the cylinder. Indicate why this happens. Justify your reasoning in terms of the interaction between the atoms of gas and the lid.

(b) Derive an expression for the minimum temperature of the gas that would result in the lid accelerating upward in terms of <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>, <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math>, <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>N</mi></math>, <math alttext="P sub atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>atm</mtext></msub></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate.

(c) Immediately after the lid loses contact with the cylinder, a small gap exists between the lid and the cylinder. Very shortly after the lid loses contact with the cylinder, the lid falls back to its original position. Indicate the process that is responsible for this. Justify your response by referring to the equation derived in part (b).
